CatDescriptText: Mr. Willie Lewis, housing authority janitor, 3142 Cordell Place, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the District Attorney's office and the courts are exerting all out efforts in prosecuting equal rights cases in which Negroes are the victims?"  Answer reads: "Alderman Fitzgerald is fair and stern in handling the cases. But other cases, which go into courts for settlement, are not handled fairly."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of man wearing dark cap, light colored sweatshirt, and dark jacket with two breast pockets, standing in front of brick building with shopping carts in background
